kafe.plugin.carousel.name: kafe.plugin.carousel
kafe.plugin.carousel.description:
### Version 1.0.2
Carousel, image scroller, ticker, whatever you wanna call it...

They can also be interacted with remotely by first, linking to the carousel using the `data-kafecarousel-id` attribute and then choosing a specific action with the `data-kafecarousel-action` attribute.
Possible actions are `nav`, `start`, `prev`, `next`, `end`, `items`, `item`, `play`, `pause`, `position`, `total`, `status` and `status-num`.

kafe.plugin.menu.name: kafe.plugin.menu
kafe.plugin.menu.description:
### Version 1.0
Attaches javascript behaviors to an HTML menu structure to create a *dropdown* style navigation.

To preserve flexibility, the plugin only controls events, speeds, delays and callbacks. It will only manage a single custom class (`kafe-quickmenu-open`) on the handle elements upon opening or closing, leaving the positioning, visibility and other asthetic responsabilities to its css.

props.name: url

classitems.description: Attach behaviors to the carousel structure.
classitems.name: init

props.name: id
props.description: `id` of the slide container.

props.name: wrap
props.description: If true, will loop back to the first slide upon reaching the last one. The same is enabled in reverse.

props.name: transition
props.description: Animation used during a transition. Possible values are `slideLeft`, `slideRight`, `slideUp`, `slideDown` and `fade`.

props.name: speed
props.description: Duration (in milliseconds) of the transition.

props.name: startId
props.description: Index of the starting slide, starting at 1.

props.name: autostart
props.description: Allows slides to change without a user interaction after a chosen delay.

props.name: interval
props.description: Delay (in milliseconds) before starting a transition to the next slide. The transition duration is included in the delay. As an example, an `interval` of 3000 combined with a `speed` of 500 will hold a slide still for 2500 milliseconds before starting the transition.

props.name: preSwitchCallback
props.description: Trigged upon receiving an instruction to change the current slide but before starting the transition. The following object is passed as a first argument:

props.name: data
props.description: An object containing information relative to the transition in progress.

props.name: data.action
props.description: Current action being performed. Possible values are `prev`, `next` or `item` when using a specific index.

props.name: data.source
props.description: Information about the slide being changed.

props.name: data.source.position
props.description: Index of the source slide.

props.name: data.source.obj
props.description: Reference to the source slide.

props.name: data.target
props.description: Information about the destination slide.

props.name: data.target.position
props.description: Index of the target slide.

props.name: data.target.obj
props.description: Reference to the target slide.

props.name: postSwitchCallback
props.description: Trigged upon receiving an instruction to change the current slide but before starting the transition. Passes the same argument object as the `preSwitchCallback`.

props.name: statusLink
props.description: If true, will generate navigation links in elements linked to the carousel via `data-kafecarousel-id` and the `data-kafecarousel-action="status"` attribute.

props.name: statusBullet
props.description: Text used as the content of generated link in a `statusLink` navigation.

example:
// Sample carousel structure
Back Next

// Carousels can be remotely interacted with using custom data attributes...
	kafe.plugin.carousel.init({ id: 'home-slides' });

classitems.description: Attach behaviors to the menu structure.
classitems.name: init

props.name: container
props.description: Root element of the menu strusture.

props.name: handle
props.description: Children element of the container that will serve as a handle to open and close the submenu.

props.name: submenus
props.description: Children element of the handle that will serve as a submenu, opening and closing when the handle is used.

props.name: animation
props.description: Animation used when opening and closing the submenus.

props.name: openSpeed
props.description: Duration (in milliseconds) of the opening animation.

props.name: openDelay
props.description: Delay (in milliseconds) used when entering the handle before starting the opening animation.

props.name: closeSpeed
props.description: Duration (in milliseconds) of the closing animation.

props.name: closeDelay
props.description: Delay (in milliseconds) used when exiting the handle before starting the closing animation.

props.name: enterCallback
props.description: Upon entering a handle, will be triggered after the delay but before the animation. The current submenu is passed as a first argument.

props.name: leaveCallback
props.description: Upon exiting a handle, will be triggered after the delay but before the animation. The current submenu is passed as a first argument.

example:
// Sample menu structure
  • Menu 1
    • Submenu 1.1
    • Submenu 1.2
    • Submenu 1.3
  • Menu 2
    • Submenu 2.1
    • Submenu 2.2
    • Submenu 2.3

// Attach behaviors using...
	kafe.plugin.menu.init({ container: '#main-menu > ul' });

// Or use the jQuery alternative...
	$('#main-menu > ul').kafeMenu();

classitems.description: Flexible formatting a given date object.
classitems.name: format

params.name: format
params.description: A custom format composed of %- tokens. Characters that are not part of a token will be rendered literally.

props.name: %Y,%y
props.description: Year variants: [2011, 11]

props.name: %M,%m,%A,%a,%B,%b,%C,%c
props.description: Month variants: [01, 1, January, january, Jan, jan, JA, Ja]

props.name: %D,%d,%e
props.description: Day variants: [02, 2, 2nd]

props.name: %W,%w,%X,%x,%Z,%z
props.description: Weekday variants: [Sunday, sunday, Sun, sun, Su, su]

props.name: %H,%h,%K,%k,%p
props.description: Hour variants [15, 15, 03, 3, pm]

props.name: %I,%i
props.description: Minute variants [04, 4]

props.name: %S,%s
props.description: Second variants [05, 5]

return.description: The formatted date.

classitems.description: Get a relative time expression from a specific datetime.
classitems.name: formatRelative

params.name: now
params.description: Comparative datetime object to calculate the time difference.

return.description: The relative time expression

example:
kafe.date.formatRelative(new Date('2013-07-19 6:00:00'), new Date('2013-07-19 20:00:00'), 'en');
	// returns "14 hours ago"

kafe.date.formatRelative(new Date('2013-05-19'), new Date('2013-07-19'), 'en');
	// returns "2 months ago"

classitems.description: Returns the local value for a specific key.
classitems.name: getPersistentItem

return.description: If not expiration flag was trigged (cookie or datetime), returns the local storage value. Otherwise, returns *undefined*.

classitems.description: Returns the session value for a specific key.
classitems.name: getSessionItem

return.description: If not expiration flag was trigged (cookie or datetime), returns the session storage value. Otherwise, returns *undefined*.

classitems.description: Sets the local value for a specific key with or without an expiration flag. Namespacing can be defined by using the ':' character.
classitems.name: setPersistentItem

props.name: expires
props.description: Sets a cookie of the specified key as the expiration flag. Changes to the cookie's value will flag the local storage value for the provided key as expired.

props.name: expires
props.description: Sets a time based expiration flag in *seconds*. After that time period, the local storage value for the provided key will be flagged as expired.

example:
kafe.storage.setPersistentItem('history:last-visit', '2013-07-21', { expires: 3600 });
	// The local storage value will return undefined in one hour.

kafe.storage.setPersistentItem('history:last-visit', '2013-07-21', { expires: 'last-visit-cookie' });
	// The local storage value will return undefined if the value of the cookie 'last-visit-cookie' is changed.

classitems.description: Sets the session value for a specific key with or without an expiration flag. Namespacing can be defined by using the ':' character.
classitems.name: setSessionItem

props.name: expires
props.description: Sets a cookie of the specified key as the expiration flag. Changes to the cookie's value will flag the session storage value for the provided key as expired.

props.name: expires
props.description: Sets a time based expiration flag in *seconds*. After that time period, the session storage value for the provided key will be flagged as expired.

example:
kafe.storage.setSessionItem('user:first-name', 'John', { expires: 3600 });
	// The session storage value will return undefined in one hour.

kafe.storage.setSessionItem('user:first-name', 'John', { expires: 'logged-user' });
	// The session storage value will return undefined if the value of the cookie 'logged-user' is changed.

classitems.description: Removes the local storage value for a specific key.
classitems.name: removePersistentItem

classitems.description: Removes the session storage value for a specific key.
classitems.name: removeSessionItem

classitems.name: getPersistentNamespaceKeys

return.description: A list of keys.

classitems.description: Returns an array of session storage keys for a specific namespace.
classitems.name: getSessionNamespaceKeys

return.description: A list of keys.

classitems.description: Returns all local storage key values for a specific namespace.
classitems.name: getPersistentNamespaceItems

return.description: An object containing all local key/value combinations for the namespace.

classitems.description: Returns all session storage key values for a specific namespace.
classitems.name: getSessionNamespaceItems

return.description: An object containing all session key/value combinations for the namespace.

classitems.description: Removes all local storage keys of a specific namespace.
classitems.name: removePersistentNamespace

classitems.description: Removes all session storage keys of a specific namespace.
classitems.name: removeSessionNamespace

classitems.description: Returns an array of all session storage keys.
classitems.name: getAllSessionKeys

return.description: A list of keys.

classitems.description: Returns all local storage key values.
classitems.name: getAllPersistentItems

return.description: An object containing all local key/value combinations.

classitems.description: Returns all session storage key values.
classitems.name: getAllSessionItems

return.description: An object containing all session key/value combinations.

classitems.description: Removes all local storage keys.
classitems.name: removeAllPersistent

classitems.description: Removes all session storage keys.
classitems.name: removeAllSession

classitems.description: Get the JSON response of a webservice and keep it in the session storage with or without an expiration flag. Use this shorthand method to prevent unnecessary communication with the server on ajax heavy websites. All session keys used with this method are part of the *kafe-storage-getJSON* namespace.
classitems.name: getJSON

props.name: expires
props.description: Sets a cookie of the specified key as the expiration flag. Changes to the cookie's value will force a new call to the webservice on the next use.

props.name: expires
props.description: Sets a time based expiration flag in *seconds*. After that time period, the next use will call the webservice instead of using the session storage.

props.name: callback
props.description: Callback triggered if the response is successful or a session stored value exists. The response (or stored value) is passed as the first argument.

example:
kafe.storage.getJSON('/UserServices/GetUserInfos?username=john_doe', { expires: 3600 });
	// Using this same line will use the session stored value instead of calling the service unless one hour has passed.

classitems.description: Encrypts a given string to md5.
classitems.name: md5

return.description: The encrypted value.

classitems.description: Checks if a string is empty or contains only whitespaces.
classitems.name: isEmpty

return.description: If true, the string is empty or contains only whitespaces.

classitems.description: Checks if a string is numeric.
classitems.name: isNum

return.description: If true, the string could be converted to a number.

classitems.description: Checks if a string is a valid email address.
classitems.name: isEmail

return.description: If true, the string is a valid email address.

classitems.description: Checks if a string is a valid or part of a valid Canadian postal code.
classitems.name: isPostalCode

params.name: format
params.description: Validation pattern (Regular expression). Default pattern is *([a-z][0-9]){3}*. Can also be set to *A1A 1A1* for a single precise value or as *A1A* and *1A1* when divided into two values.

return.description: If true, the string matches the validation format.

classitems.description:
Checks if a string is a valid credit card number and fits a specific brand pattern.

Source: [http://davidwalsh.name/validate-credit-cards](http://davidwalsh.name/validate-credit-cards)
classitems.name: isCreditCard

params.name: cardtype
params.description: A credit card brand abbreviation. Possible values are **mc** (Master Card), **ec** (Electronic Cash), **vi** (Visa), **ax** (American Express), **dc** (DC), **bl** (BL), **di** (Diner's Club), **jcb** (JCB) or **er** (ER).

return.description: If true, the string is a valid credit card number.

classitems.description: Removes accented charaters from a string.
classitems.name: removeAccent

return.description: The unaccented string.

example:
kafe.string.removeAccent('Kafe signifie caf en crole.');
	// returns "Kafe signifie cafe en creole."

classitems.description: Transforms a JSON string into a javascript object.
classitems.name: toObject

return.description: A valid javascript object.

example:
kafe.string.toObject('{"UserId":"456","Items":["first", "second", "last"],"State":true,"TotalAmount":52,"Taxes":[]}');
	// returns Object {UserId: "456", Items: Array[3], State: true, TotalAmount: 52, Taxes: Array[0]}

classitems.description: Generates a random GUID/UUID. (Version 4, random)
classitems.name: generateGuid

return.description: A random valid GUID/UUID.

classitems.description: Equalizes the height css property of every element in a selector. If no height is currently present, the method computes the height values before equalizing. Elements must be visible at the time or will be considered as having a height of 0.
classitems.name: equalHeight

props.name: nbPerRow
props.description: Allows the elements to be compared in groups of a given number.

props.name: resetHeight
props.description: Resets css height of all elements to 'auto' before comparing.

props.name: borderBox
props.description: If true, heights will be computed as if the elements had the 'box-sizing' css attribute to 'border-box'.

classitems.description: Replaces <hr> tags into <div class="hr"></div> tags to eliminate styling restrictions.
classitems.name: replaceHr

params.name: selector
params.description: Restricts the process to a specific context.

classitems.description: Vertically align an element inside its parent. Elements must be visible at the time or positioning calculations will fail.
classitems.name: vAlign

params.name: parent
params.description: Container in which we want to be centered.
